For roles based in San Francisco or New York City, the estimated hourly range for this role is $55/hr for Bachelors and $59/hr for Master’s.

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
**This is a permanent (FTE) position that will be hired directly by an Insight Global client**




Job Description: Master Data Analyst (FTE) - San Francisco, CA

You will act as the single owner and subject matter expert for all master data, including but not limited to customer, vendor, chart of accounts, and product data.

Own and manage master data across customer, vendor, product, and financial domains
Ensure data integrity through validation rules, quality checks, and cleansing initiatives
Define and enforce data governance policies, metadata standards, and compliance controls
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align master data with business requirements
Administer master data systems (Netsuite, Planful, Salesforce, Workiva), including access and configuration
Support system integrations and troubleshoot data quality issues across platforms
Maintain accurate data for financial planning and reporting; provide ad-hoc analysis for audits and decision-making




Required Skills & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in finance, Accounting, Information Systems, or a related quantitative field.
3-5+ years of experience in a data analyst, master data, or data governance role, within a public company.
Hands-on experience with Netsuite, and Planful is high preferred, but any FP&A tool will work
Strong understanding of financial processes (e.g., Procure-to-Pay, Order-to-Cash) and the impact of master data on financial reporting.
Familiarity with financial reporting requirements for public companies (e.g., SOX compliance).




Nice to Have Skills & Experience (Not Required)

Salesforce and Workia tool experience




Salary Range: $100k - $150k

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has a client that is seeking a Senior Data Analyst for a contract role, 6 months to start. This position is in the Greater Bay Area - expected potential hybrid in Oakland and/or San Ramon once per week (can choose). Summary: Our client is seeking a highly skilled and strategic Senior Data Analyst to support our client's Vegetation Management organization. This role will serve as a key analytical partner, responsible for transforming complex datasets into actionable insights that drive operational efficiency and strategic decision-making. The Analyst will lead the development of advanced reporting solutions in Power BI, conduct deep-dive analyses using Excel and other tools, and deliver executive-level presentations that highlight trends, risks, and opportunities across the business. Duties/Day to Day:


Lead the analysis of large, complex datasets to uncover trends, forecast outcomes, and identify areas for operational improvement
Design, build, and maintain dynamic dashboards and reporting solutions in Power BI to support strategic initiatives and performance tracking
Perform advanced Excel modeling, including scenario analysis, forecasting, and data transformation
Partner with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and translate them into analytical frameworks and reporting solutions
Develop executive-level presentations using Excel and PowerPoint to communicate insights, trends, and recommendations to senior leadership


Requirements


Experience in a data analyst or business intelligence role, preferably in a utility or operations-focused environment
Exceptional communication and presentation skills; Experience with the task of distilling complex data into clear, actionable insights, and creating PPTs to outline these insights and trends
Proven experience working with large datasets and relational databases
Familiarity with Salesforce or similar CRM platforms is preferred
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including complex formulas, pivot tables, and data modeling
Deep expertise in Power BI, including DAX, data modeling, and visualization best practices
Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and a proactive approach to identifying and addressing business needs
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities and deliver high-impact work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Strong analytical mindset
Ability to communicate data-driven narratives to senior leadership
SQL proficiency is a strong plus


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

By clicking “Apply Today” you agree to receive calls, AI-generated calls, text messages or emails from Kforce and its affiliates, and service providers. Note that if you choose to communicate with Kforce via text messaging the frequency may vary, and message and data rates may apply. Carriers are not liable for delayed or undelivered messages. You will always have the right to cease communicating via text by using key words such as STOP.

Title: Data Science Intern, Decisions - Product (Summer 2026)
Description:
At Lyft, our purpose is to serve and connect. We aim to achieve this by cultivating a work environment where all team members belong and have the opportunity to thrive.

Data is at the heart of how Lyft makes business and product decisions. As a data science team, we work collaboratively with partners across product, engineering, operations and growth to develop business insights and make actionable recommendations. We’re looking for passionate data scientists to take on some of the most interesting and impactful problems in ridesharing.

You’ll work in an environment where we embrace moving quickly to build the world’s best transportation. Data Scientists pursue a variety of problems ranging from understanding our passengers and drivers, to ensuring we have an efficient marketplace, to optimizing how we run our marketing and growth incentives. You’ll dig into the data to uncover insights, design experiments and measure the impact, and help influence decision-making across the entire organization.

As a Data Science Intern on the Decisions: Product track, you will focus on Data Science for humans. Your output shapes decisions made by executives, product managers, operations and business teams, and beyond. This role relies upon an ability to apply decision frameworks and a deep understanding of the business and product to drive alignment on problems and solutions.

You will report into a Science Manager.

Responsibilities:


Build and automate relevant models and reporting for important business processes
Perform deep-dives into our customer data to understand passenger and driver behavior
Develop strong hypotheses, create solutions, and uncover business insights to increase growth
Design and analyze experiments to increase engagement with the Lyft platform
Partner and develop strong relationships with diverse teams across product, marketing, and engineering


Experience:


Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in data science, computer science, economics, applied math, engineering, statistics or another quantitative field; or in a hard science field, such as physics, biology, biostatistics, etc.
Currently attending a university and graduating between December 2026 and Summer 2027 (required). For any candidates who are master's students who worked between their bachelor's and master's programs: candidates should also have less than 2 years of relevant full-time work experience.
Available during Summer 2026 for the internship in San Francisco
Comfortable working with very large datasets
Experience analyzing data in Python or R; strong proficiency in SQL
Experimentation design and analysis of A/B tests
Effective communication skills; detail-oriented
Passion for community, sustainability, or transportation
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment


Benefits:


Great medical, dental, and vision insurance options
Mental health benefits
In addition to holidays, interns receive 2 days paid time off and 3 days sick time off
401(k) plan to help save for your future
Pre-tax commuter benefits
Lyft Pink - Lyft team members get an exclusive opportunity to test new benefits of our Ridership Program


Lyft is an equal opportunity employer committed to an inclusive workplace that fosters belonging. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, age, genetic information, or any other basis prohibited by law. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

Lyft highly values having employees working in-office to foster a collaborative work environment and company culture. This role will be in-office on a hybrid schedule — Team Members will be expected to work in the office 3 days per week on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. Lyft considers working in the office at least 3 days per week to be an essential function of this hybrid role. Your recruiter can share more information about the various in-office perks Lyft offers. #Hybrid

The expected base pay range for this position in the San Francisco area is $54-$58/hour USD. Salary ranges are dependent on a variety of factors, including qualifications, experience and geographic location. Range is not inclusive of potential equity offering, bonus or benefits. Your recruiter can share more information about the salary range specific to your working location and other factors during the hiring process.

Title: Operations Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Operations Data Analyst

Location: Hybrid onsite in Oakland, CA (2 days per week)

Duration: 12 month contract - extensions expected (W2)




Required Skills & Experience

• BA/BS Degree in Marketing, Business, Computer Science, Engineering or other related field or equivalent work experience

• 6 years of related work experience

• Familiarity with utility operations

• Advanced skill in Microsoft Excel/Access (complex formulas, graphing, VBA)

• Advanced skill in visualization tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau, etc.)

• Advanced skill in writing SQL queries using Oracle or Business Objects

• Strong knowledge of base-SAS and programming language such as Visual Basic, Perl, C

• Strong organizational, prioritization and multi-tasking skills.

• Strong problem-solving skills.

• Influence skills.

• Advanced project management skills to lead cross functional teams.




Nice to Have Skills & Experience




• Experience/knowledge of GIS and/or SAP

• Experience with Copperleaf and/or Foundry

• Masters Degree




Job Description




Evergreen, Insight Global’s Manage Service Division partners with a large local utility company’s Integrated Grid Planning team. Looking for an Operations Data Analyst and the responsibilities would include but aren’t limited to:

• Manages complex data analysis projects with limited supervision on only the most complex projects from initial request to presenting data results ensuring that the project is completed within budget and on-time.

• Designs data analysis to achieve business objectives, process data, analyze data, write clear and concise data findings and tailor communications to specific audiences.

• Creates automated data routines and processes for reporting and data delivery ensuring accurate data manipulation and data cleansing.

• Manages extracting data and transferring the data from databases to various analysts to support operational analysis efforts

• Demonstrates and utilizes broad expertise in data processing and data analysis and applies this knowledge to several different issues.

• Provides new and innovative solutions and recommendations to enhance database(s) with new data sources and improved data processes.

• Develops comprehensive reports and communicates clear, concise, and actionable data analyses for clients.

• Works with Directors and Managers across functions to influence decisions.

• Analyze business data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for operational and strategic improvements.

• Collect, clean, and integrate data from various sources, including SAP, Foundry, GIS, and Copperleaf, to support business operations and asset planning.

• Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations using tools like Power BI or Tableau to communicate insights and performance metrics.

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs, identify challenges, and translate them into data-driven solutions.

• Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide actionable recommendations for improvement.

• Perform ad hoc analyses and present findings to stakeholders in a clear, concise, and actionable format, including responding to data requests.

• Ensure data quality, integrity, and governance across systems and reporting platforms, supporting best practices in data management.







Compensation: $40.00-50.00/HR

Title: Analytics Consultant
Description:
About This Role

Wells Fargo is seeking an Analytics Consultant as part of the Strategy, Digital and Innovation (SDI) team. For additional information on this line of business, refer to the external Careers Site at www.wellsfargojobs.com .

The Commercial Banking and Corporate Investment Banking Digital Analytics team is looking for an analyst to provide reporting, analytics, strategy and insights. Ideal candidates will have Digital experience transforming data into insights, communicating complexities to partners with various levels of analytic concepts. Previous knowledge of Digital Commercial Banking and Corporate Investment Banking preferred.

The ideal candidate is a self starter, adept at solving problems, capable of utilizing multiple analytic tools (including AI tools) and flexible to learning new techniques and/or tools to solve data and business problems.

In This Role, You Will


Consult with business line and enterprise functions on less complex research
Use functional knowledge to assist in non-model quantitative tools that support strategic decision making
Perform analysis of findings and trends using statistical analysis and document process
Present recommendations to increase revenue, reduce expense, maximize operational efficiency, quality, and compliance
Identify and define business requirements and translate data and business needs into research and recommendations to improve efficiency
Develop customized reports and ad hoc analyses to make recommendations and provide guidance to less experienced staff
Understand compliance and risk management requirements for supported area
Ensure adherence to data management or data governance regulations and policies
Participate in company initiatives or processes to assist in meeting risk and capital objectives and other strategic goals
Collaborate and consult with more experienced consultants and with partners in technology and other business groups


Required Qualifications:


2+ years of Analytics experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education


Desired Qualifications:


Knowledge of programming languages such as SQL, SAS, Python, R
Knowledge of BI delivery tools such as Tableau or PowerBI


Job Expectations:


Position is not eligible for visa sponsorship
Not eligible for 100% remote work. Candidates must be willing to commit to working on site.


* depending on applicant volume this role could be removed early*

Pay Range

Reflected is the base pay range offered for this position. Pay may vary depending on factors including but not limited to achievements, skills, experience, or work location. The range listed is just one component of the compensation package offered to candidates.

$68,000.00 - $125,000.00

Benefits

Wells Fargo provides eligible employees with a comprehensive set of benefits, many of which are listed below. Visit Benefits - Wells Fargo Jobs for an overview of the following benefit plans and programs offered to employees.


Health benefits
401(k) Plan
Paid time off
Disability benefits
Life insurance, critical illness insurance, and accident insurance
Parental leave
Critical caregiving leave
Discounts and savings
Commuter benefits
Tuition reimbursement
Scholarships for dependent children
Adoption reimbursement


Posting End Date:

1 Oct 2025


Job posting may come down early due to volume of applicants.


We Value Equal Opportunity

Wells Fargo is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected characteristic.

Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.

Applicants With Disabilities

To request a medical accommodation during the application or interview process, visit Disability Inclusion at Wells Fargo .

Drug and Alcohol Policy

Wells Fargo maintains a drug free workplace. Please see our Drug and Alcohol Policy to learn more.

Wells Fargo Recruitment And Hiring Requirements


Third-Party recordings are prohibited unless authorized by Wells Fargo.
Wells Fargo requires you to directly represent your own experiences during the recruiting and hiring process.


Reference Number

R-490344-1

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Envoy builds workspace management technology that makes it simple to run secure, compliant, and connected workplaces across every location. Over 16,000 workplaces and properties around the world rely on Envoy to create great experiences for employees and visitors while meeting safety, security, and compliance needs at scale. From corporate headquarters and labs to manufacturing sites, Envoy powers the places where people work best together.

Learn more at envoy.com

About The Role

We are a data-driven organization that values analytical rigor, innovation, and collaborative impact. Our team maintains high standards across our modern data stack, engineering practices, and analytical frameworks while fostering a culture of continuous learning and diverse perspectives.

We're seeking an experienced data professional to accelerate our analytics capabilities and drive strategic decision-making across the organization. You'll collaborate with product, marketing, sales, and engineering teams to deliver actionable insights, build predictive models, and influence key business decisions through data storytelling and evidence-based recommendations.

Our data platform is built on a modern stack including AWS Redshift, Apache Spark, AWS Glue, dbt, and Airflow for orchestration. We leverage Looker and Databricks for analytics and exploration. We're actively exploring real-time analytics solutions, MLOps tooling like SageMaker, MLflow, and Feature Stores, as well as incorporating generative AI use cases using LangChain, LLM APIs, and vector databases.

This is an on-site position that requires 4 days a week (Monday-Thursday) in our San Francisco HQ.

You will

Strategic Analysis & Insights


Partner with cross-functional teams to design and execute high-impact analytics projects that drive product strategy and business growth
Develop sophisticated analyses using modern statistical methods, machine learning, and causal inference techniques
Conduct deep-dive investigations into user behavior, product performance, and market trends


Advanced Analytics & Modeling


Build and deploy predictive models, recommendation systems, and forecasting solutions
Design and implement robust A/B testing frameworks and analyze experimental results
Create automated reporting dashboards and real-time monitoring systems


Data Leadership & Strategy


Influence product roadmap and business strategy through compelling data narratives and executive presentations
Establish analytics best practices and data governance standards
Mentor junior analysts and contribute to team knowledge sharing


Innovation & Research


Explore emerging analytics techniques, including generative AI applications for data analysis
Evaluate and implement new tools and technologies to enhance analytical capabilities
Contribute to our data science research initiatives and thought leadership


You are

Technical Excellence


You have exceptionally high standards for data quality and analytical rigor, understanding that trust in data is fundamental to business impact
You're pragmatic about balancing perfection with delivery timelines, always striving for excellence while maintaining velocity
You think systematically about data architecture, measurement frameworks, and end-to-end analytical processes


Business Acumen


You're an owner who takes personal accountability for outcomes and proactively identifies opportunities for improvement
You thrive in fast-paced environments where your work directly impacts product decisions and business results
You have strong product intuition and can translate complex analytical findings into actionable business recommendations


Growth Mindset


You're passionate about continuous learning, staying current with emerging tools, methodologies, and industry best practices
You're intellectually curious and eager to explore new analytical approaches and technologies
You value feedback and actively seek opportunities to improve your craft


Collaboration & Communication


You're emotionally intelligent and prioritize team success over individual recognition
You excel at explaining complex analytical concepts to diverse audiences, from engineers to executives
You're empathetic and supportive, particularly when mentoring junior team members


You have

Education & Experience


Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, or related quantitative field
5+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or related roles
Proven track record of influencing business strategy through data-driven insights


Technical Skills


Expert-level SQL proficiency with experience in modern data warehouses (Redshift,Postgres, Databricks)
Advanced Python skills with deep knowledge of data science libraries (pandas, scikit-learn, numpy, matplotlib, seaborn)
Experience with modern analytics tools such as dbt, Looker, Tableau, or similar. Hands-on expertise with dbt for building modular, version-controlled, and testable data transformation pipelines.
Proficiency in statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and experimental design
Working knowledge of version control (Git) and command-line tools


Analytical Expertise


Strong foundation in applied statistics, regression analysis, and machine learning
Experience with A/B testing, causal inference, and experimental design
Ability to create compelling data visualizations and interactive dashboards
Experience with time series analysis and forecasting techniques


Bonus points

Advanced Technical Skills


Experience with cloud platforms including AWS (preferred), GCP, and Azure, with a strong understanding of modern data infrastructure and services.
Knowledge of machine learning operations (MLOps) and model deployment
Familiarity with real-time analytics and streaming data processing


Business & Leadership


Track record of success in fast-paced startup or scale-up environments
Experience leading cross-functional analytics projects
Background in product analytics, growth metrics, or business intelligence
Experience with modern experimentation platforms and statistical methods


Emerging Technologies


Familiarity with generative AI tools and their applications in data analysis
Experience with automated reporting and self-service analytics platforms
Knowledge of data mesh architectures and modern data governance frameworks


You'll get


High degree of autonomy and trust in your analytical judgment
Direct impact on product strategy and business outcomes
Mentorship opportunities and career development support
Collaborative environment with talented, diverse team members
Opportunity to shape the future of workplace technology through data


If you have any questions related to compensation, please contact Recruiting after you apply.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge that you have fully read and understand the job requirements and received the Envoy Privacy Notice for applicants, which is linked here. Completing this application requires you to provide personal data, such as your name and contact information, which is mandatory for Envoy to process your application. Envoy is an EEO Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of any characteristic protected by local, state or federal law.

Compensation Range: $162.5K - $180K

  • Advanced Python skills with deep knowledge of data science libraries (pandas, scikit-learn, numpy, matplotlib, seaborn)

Compensation Range: $162.5K - $180K

Title: Product Growth Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for growth leaders for products used by billions of people and businesses all over the world across our apps including Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and Oculus. This is a leadership opportunity to drive impact end-to-end through the product development life cycle. The product growth analyst role is embedded within product teams and requires using a mix of skills including analysis, product ideation, and cross-functional collaboration. Success in the role is tied directly to product goals and the team rewards results-based performance.The Growth practice was started right here at Meta, putting you at the forefront of the industry with great opportunity to learn about growth from experts. It is a lean and highly regarded team with an emphasis on regular sharing of successful strategies, tactics and insights across products. Our team values are to own the outcome, focus on driving sustainable impact, and put team success first. There is great opportunity to be a leader and influence the direction of high-visibility and high-impact initiatives, and to have your work come to life in some of the most widely used apps in the world.

Product Growth Analyst Responsibilities:


Lead growth strategy across a large product area and drive cross-team alignment
Drive long term growth of Meta Inc products through a combination of data analysis, product ideation, and experimentation to optimize product experiences
Understand trends in user behavior and product usage to influence growth strategy
Identify opportunities to drive growth and prioritize them to maximize long-term growth
Execute on projects by working closely with engineering and other members of product teams to land impact on product goals. Lead experimentation from designing tests to analyzing results that lead to launch decisions


Minimum Qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in a directly related field, or equivalent practical experience
6+ years of experience working in an analytical or product role
Proven to effectively collaborate across variety of technical and non-technical functions to drive towards common product goals
Experience working with and influencing multi disciplinary product teams consisting but not limited to software engineers, designers, product managers and data scientists
Proficiency in quantitative analysis geared towards drawing actionable insights from complex datasets
Experience performing exploratory analysis with minimal direction to answer ambiguous open ended questions
Experimentation experience to design multivariate tests, synthesize test results and build frameworks to make data-informed launch decisions
Product ideation skills to apply growth tactics broadly to different product areas and think through detailed elements of a product experience
Experience with data querying languages (for example, SQL)
Experience working on a product or service used by a wide-range of communities


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$133,000/year to $185,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
At Compass, our mission is to help everyone find their place in the world. Founded in 2012, we’re revolutionizing the real estate industry with our end-to-end platform that empowers residential real estate agents to deliver exceptional service to seller and buyer clients.

The Transaction Operations Lean Process Excellence team is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to drive reporting and data analytics initiatives within the Regional Operations team that make the organization more efficient, more effective, and more profitable. This role involves partnering with a broad scope of stakeholders to design, build, and implement data analytics tools in an operational environment. This individual will thrive in a high-growth, collaborative, dynamic environment and will create an environment that is relentlessly focused on building robust, accurate, and user-friendly tools and dashbaords. This is a full-time position that will report directly into the Director of Lean Process Excellence, Analytics, and Reporting.

If you are passionate about building and using data to drive efficiency and effectiveness, we’d be thrilled to have you

At Compass You Will


Work with complex data sets to architect and validate accurate solutions for tracking long-term performance of teams and individuals and prioritize work.
Collaborate with a broad set of stakeholders to define and align on functional requirements that capture the voice of the customer and the voice of the process.
Analyze trends in data to suggest actions for improving/adherence to Key Performance Indicators and Service Level Agreements.
Build compelling and impactful visualizations and artifacts using tools such as Microsoft Power BI to empower end users to self-serve and use data in their day-to-day processes.
Collaborate with other Data Scientists and Project Managers to ensure consistency in Suite of reporting and good user experience.
Contribute to a data-driven culture focused on leveraging data insights for key strategic and tacitcal decisions.
Collaborate with central Business Intelligence and Data Quality teams to ensure adherence and contribute to data governance, data hygiene, and data quality.


What We Look For


3+ years of relevant industry experience in a technical engineering and/or analytics capacity
Proven experience working with business users to translate requirements into scalable assets that deliver actionable insights and enable self-service analysis
Advanced SQL, DAX and data modeling skills
Proficient programming skills in data transformation and preparation using SQL and/or Python
Proven experience in data wrangling and developing visualizations with tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker, etc
Experience working with cloud-based data lakehouses (e.g Databricks, Redshift)
Strong understanding of data modeling and software engineering best practices
Preferred experience with a programming language (Python, PySpark, R, Scala, etc)
Growth mindset, self-starter with a desire to continually learn and improve
Team player, willingness to work within a collaborative team environment
Passion for solving challenging, complex problems in a fast-paced & sometimes ambiguous environment


Compensation

The base pay range for this position is $85,800 - $128,800 annually; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Bonuses and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of benefits. Base pay is based on market location. Minimum wage for the position will always be met.

Perks That You Need To Know About

Participation in our incentive programs (which may include eligible cash, equity, or commissions). Plus paid vacation, holidays, sick time, parental leave, and recharge leave; medical, tele-health, dental and vision benefits; 401(k) plan; flexible spending accounts (FSAs); commuter program; life and disability insurance; Maven (a support system for new parents); Carrot (fertility benefits); UrbanSitter (caregiver referral network); Employee Assistance Program; and pet insurance.

Do your best work, be your authentic self.

At Compass, we believe that everyone deserves to find their place in the world — a place where they feel like they belong, where they can be their authentic selves, where they can thrive. Our collaborative, energetic culture is grounded in our Compass Entrepreneurship Principles and our commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, growth and mobility. As an equal opportunity employer, we offer competitive compensation packages, robust benefits and professional growth opportunities aimed at helping to improve our employees' lives and careers.

Notice for California Applicants

Los Angeles County Fair Chance Notice

Title: Fraud Risk Data Analyst
Description:
About Rippling

Rippling gives businesses one place to run HR, IT, and Finance. It brings together all of the workforce systems that are normally scattered across a company, like payroll, expenses, benefits, and computers. For the first time ever, you can manage and automate every part of the employee lifecycle in a single system.

Take onboarding, for example. With Rippling, you can hire a new employee anywhere in the world and set up their payroll, corporate card, computer, benefits, and even third-party apps like Slack and Microsoft 365—all within 90 seconds.

Based in San Francisco, CA, Rippling has raised $1.4B+ from the world’s top investors—including Kleiner Perkins, Founders Fund, Sequoia, Greenoaks, and Bedrock—and was named one of America's best startup employers by Forbes.

We prioritize candidate safety. Please be aware that all official communication will only be sent from @Rippling.com addresses.

About The Role

As a Fraud Data Analyst at Rippling, you will play a key role in safeguarding the financial integrity of our clients by identifying and mitigating fraud risks across our suite of financial products. Rippling's Fraud Risk team is looking for a Fraud Risk Data Analyst to help protect the company and its customers from fraud. We're looking for a driven and strategic thinker to focus on our new customer onboarding and fraud detection processes. In this role, you'll be instrumental in developing strategies that block bad actors from the Rippling platform while preserving a seamless experience for legitimate businesses. This is an excellent opportunity to leverage your skills in data analytics to drive strategic and impactful results, grow your career in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

What You Will Do


Develop and maintain fraud detection rules and models tailored to the onboarding workflow to detect and block bad actors, continuously refining them to address emerging fraud risks
Work closely with the Fraud, Security, Sales, Customer Experience, and Compliance teams to improve fraud onboarding and detection processes and roll out new product risk controls
Identify suspicious activities and fraud patterns, and perform thorough investigations on high-risk bad actors when necessary. Leverage data analysis and fraud detection tools to make informed decisions.
Utilize SQL to regularly assess fraud risk across new customers, recommending and implementing strategies to minimize risk and improve fraud prevention effectiveness.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide regular reports on fraud losses, false positive rates, and team efficiency to senior management


What You Will Need


2+ years of experience as a data analyst in a fraud, risk, or security function, with a focus on customer onboarding or underwriting.
Strong SQL skills with the ability to write complex queries to analyze large datasets, identify trends, and generate fraud-related reports. Experience with SQL-based tools (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, or similar databases) is essential.
Experience with business intelligence tools like Tableau, Looker, or similar.
Effective communication and presentation skills, capable of articulating complex data and risk insights to various stakeholders.


Nice to Have


In-depth understanding of payments risks and funds flows, specifically within ACH and bank transfer fraud, account takeovers, wallet and corporate card transaction fraud
Experience in SaaS or FinTech environments: Prior experience working in a fast-paced, tech-driven environment with a focus on financial services or SaaS is beneficial.


Additional Information

Rippling is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce and do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other legally protected characteristics, Rippling is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities who need assistance during the hiring process. To request a reasonable accommodation, please email accomodations@rippling.com

Rippling highly values having employees working in-office to foster a collaborative work environment and company culture. For office-based employees (employees who live within a defined radius of a Rippling office), Rippling considers working in the office, at least three days a week under current policy, to be an essential function of the employee's role.

This role will receive a competitive salary + benefits + equity. The salary for US-based employees will be aligned with one of the ranges below based on location; see which tier applies to your location here.

A variety of factors are considered when determining someone’s compensation–including a candidate’s professional background, experience, and location. Final offer amounts may vary from the amounts listed below.

The pay range for this role is:

124,000 - 155,000 USD per year(US Tier 1)

Title: Sr. Analyst, Strategic Analytics
Description:
Why PlayStation?

PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.

PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.

The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Group Corporation.

Senior Analyst, Strategic Analytics

San Mateo, CA / Hybrid

As a Senior Analyst on the Commercial Analytics Team, you will drive strategic, data-led projects that fuel growth across Global Marketing, Sales, and Business Operations (GMSBO), with a primary focus on the PlayStation Direct D2C business. You'll analyze conversion funnels, assess console, accessory, and bundle performance, and measure the impact of promotional campaigns. This highly cross-functional role partners closely with senior stakeholders to deliver clear, actionable insights through data storytelling. You’ll also help expand data capabilities by integrating new data sources, coding business rules, and developing metrics that address key business challenges. E-commerce and D2C experience is strongly preferred.

What you will be doing:


Act as an Analytics Business Partner, collaborating with senior stakeholders to deliver insights that inform strategic and tactical decisions.
Lead the analytics and reporting strategy, building processes, business rhythms, and frameworks to drive growth.
Define reporting objectives and performance insights in partnership with cross-functional teams, piloting scalable solutions and partnering with reporting teams to enable self-service reporting.
Translate analyses into business implications, linking insights directly to commercial outcomes.
Present high-quality, actionable insights and recommendations to technical, non-technical, and senior audiences. Represent Strategic Analytics in key meetings.
Own and prioritize the PlayStation Direct analytics roadmap, knowing when to escalate or seek guidance.
Improve analytical capabilities across the team by documenting techniques and insights, and mentoring peers to elevate collective knowledge.
This role will primarily support the PlayStation Direct business, but may flex to support other GMSBO commercial analytics needs.


Qualifications:


5+ years in analytics or related field, with experience supporting e-commerce or direct-to-consumer businesses.
5+ years of SQL; skilled at analyzing large, disparate data sets.
Understanding of statistical analysis (regression, hypothesis testing, time series analysis).
Proven ability to influence senior business leaders and shape strategy through analytics.
Strong data storytelling skills to create concise, senior-level presentations.
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to develop strong relationships in a globally diverse organization, recognizing different working styles, cultures, and time zones.
Exceptional problem-solving skills, a growth mindset, and a proactive, curious approach.


Preferred qualifications:


Familiarity with web analytics platforms such as Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics.
Additional experience in Python and BI tool such as Domo/Tableau.
Experience in gaming, entertainment, or media is a plus but not required.


Types of analysis might include, but are not limited to:


Product launch analysis
Supporting business casing for new products/propositions
Player profiling (new vs. returning) and identifying opportunities to grow the base
Cohort analyses
Promotions effectiveness


Please refer to our Candidate Privacy Notice for more information about how we process your personal information, and your data protection rights.

At SIE, we consider several factors when setting each role’s base pay range, including the competitive benchmarking data for the market and geographic location.

Please note that the base pay range may vary in line with our hybrid working policy and individual base pay will be determined based on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location.

In addition, this role is eligible for SIE’s top-tier benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, matching 401(k), paid time off, wellness program and coveted employee discounts for Sony products. This role also may be eligible for a bonus package. Click here to learn more.

The estimated base pay range for this role is listed below.

$165,900—$248,900 USD

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy, maternity or parental status, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category.

We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.


Show more

  • Supporting business casing for new products/propositions
  • Player profiling (new vs. returning) and identifying opportunities to grow the base
  • Cohort analyses
  • Promotions effectiveness

Please refer to our Candidate Privacy Notice for more information about how we process your personal information, and your data protection rights.

At SIE, we consider several factors when setting each role’s base pay range, including the competitive benchmarking data for the market and geographic location.

Please note that the base pay range may vary in line with our hybrid working policy and individual base pay will be determined based on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location.

In addition, this role is eligible for SIE’s top-tier benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, matching 401(k), paid time off, wellness program and coveted employee discounts for Sony products. This role also may be eligible for a bonus package. Click here to learn more.

The estimated base pay range for this role is listed below.

$165,900—$248,900 USD

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy, maternity or parental status, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category.

We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
The BI Analyst reports to the IT Manager for Data and Analytics and is responsible for data modeling and analysis services used to mine enterprise systems and applications for knowledge and information that enhance business processes for the San Mateo County Transit District (SamTrans), the Peninsula Corridor Joint Powers Board (Caltrain), and the San Mateo County Transportation Authority (TA). This individual is also responsible for assisting in building, deploying, and maintaining data support tools, metadata inventories, and definitions for database file/table creation.




This critical role requires deep BI and data experience and advanced data skills to deliver impactful reporting and analytics. The role will analyze complex data sets, create insightful reports, and provide actionable recommendations to support effective decision-making at all levels of the organization.




Essential Functions & Duties




Examples of Essential Functions:

Build and maintain production-level reports and dashboards using BI tools like Power BI and Tableau to support business operations.
Develop clear and visually compelling data visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Manage project scope, deliverables, and risks while collaborating with stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate them into technical requirements.
Ensure BI solutions are scalable, reliable, and secure, while developing and monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs) to track business performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize data workflows and drive analytics projects from inception to completion.
Foster self-service capabilities, empowering users to independently access and report on data.
Work with application development staff to coordinate the creation and management of data queries.
Collaborate with unit managers, end users, development staff, and other stakeholders to integrate data management applications with existing systems.
Develop, implement, and maintain change control and testing processes for modifications to data models.
In conjunction with data owners and department managers, develop data models and protocols for mining production databases.
Act as the District’s BI point of contact when the




Examples of Essential Duties:

Analyze and validate data from various sources, utilizing advanced analytics techniques to identify trends and extract meaningful insights.
Devise, develop, and deploy required data queries in response to business user needs.
Provide and apply quality assurance best practices for data analysis services across the organization.
Monitor data quality, maintain reports, investigate and fix bugs, and ensure platform stability.
Provide ad hoc analysis and support for special projects, maintaining thorough documentation of BI processes.
Contribute to best practices within the Analytics discipline.
Assist in the development of data management policies and procedures.
Identify research questions, solve problems using data analysis and communicate the results to various stakeholders.




Minimum Qualifications




Sufficient experience, training and/or education to demonstrate the knowledge and ability to successfully perform the essential functions of the position. In lieu of a degree, work-related experience that demonstrates the skills and experience necessary to perform this role will be accepted. Development of the required knowledge and abilities is typically obtained through but not limited to:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Data Science, Statistics, or a directly related field
Three (3) years of progressively responsible full-time experience as a Business Intelligence or data analyst.
Three (3) years of full-time experience utilizing BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, Looker),
Three (3) years of full-time experience with data warehousing and ETL processes.
Experience with SQL and PL.SQL.
Must be willing to work On Call and After hours as required




Preferred Qualifications:

Master’s degree in computer science, Data Science, or Statistics.
Experience with data modeling and analysis techniques.
Knowledge of statistical analysis and machine learning algorithms.
Experience with programming languages like Python or R.
Experience with multiple BI systems including various BI platforms, Datawarehouse, Data Lake, ETL tools, CRM and ERP systems, as well as Financial Planning tools.
Experience working in a high-tempo environment, adapting to day-to-day challenges.
Experience conducting research into database issues, standards, and products as required.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to present findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.




The selection process may include a panel interview, written and skills test assessments, or supplemental questions. Only those candidates who are the most qualified will continue in the selection process. Meeting the minimum qualifications does not guarantee an invitation to continue in the process.




How to Apply

Complete an online employment application by 11:59 p.m. of the listed closing date. Resumes and cover letters will not be accepted in lieu of fully completed applications. It is the applicant’s responsibility to ensure that applications are completed with all relevant information (experience, education, certifications, licenses, references and/or other information).
The Human Resources Department will make reasonable efforts in the recruitment/examination process to accommodate applicants with disabilities upon request. If you have a need for an accommodation, please contact the Human Resources Department.
We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive and welcoming workplace environment. We are an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities, Women, Persons with Disabilities and Veterans are encouraged to apply.
Show more

Title: Sr. People Analytics Associate
Description:
Who We Are

Designed with simplicity in mind, Verkada's six product lines — video security cameras, access control, environmental sensors, alarms, workplace, and intercoms — provide unparalleled building security through an integrated, cloud-based software platform. Over 33,500 organizations, including 96 companies in the Fortune 500, across 93 countries worldwide trust Verkada as their physical security layer for easier management, intelligent control, and scalable deployments. Founded in 2016 with more than $700M in funding raised to-date, Verkada has expanded rapidly with 15 offices and 2,200+ full-time employees.

About The Role

We are looking for an exceptional Sr. People Analytics Associate to join our growing People team. This role will partner with our Sr. Director of People Strategy and Operations to continue building and scaling our people analytics capability. This is a high-impact role for someone who’s excited to partner with People, Sales, Finance, and Executive teams to unlock insights that drive strategic talent decisions, improve employee experience, and support business growth.

What You'll Do


As a member of our People Strategy and Operations team, you will have an integral role in driving the insights, operations, and strategy. This role blends technical expertise, business acumen, and a passion for storytelling through data.
You will continue building the foundation for people analytics, including data pipelines, dashboards, and reporting standards across systems like Workday, Looker, Greenhouse, and Lattice.
You will partner closely with People Partners and business leaders to identify key metrics and deliver actionable insights across the employee lifecycle (e.g., hiring, attrition, engagement, organization health)
You will also partner with Recruiting Operations and Talent Aquision leaders to design and maintain recruiting analytics dashboards that provide visibility into key metrics (e.g., pipeline health, time-to-fill, source effectiveness) and equip leaders to make data-driven hiring decisions.
You will drive cross-functional analytics projects that support strategic decisions on org design, retention, performance, and compensation.
You will maintain a strong data governance framework to ensure accuracy, privacy, and consistency across systems and reporting.


What You Bring


Since we’re still in scrappy startup mode, you’ll need to be a high-impact self-starter. You take initiative to move projects forward and can operate well with little guidance.
Raw Smarts: You’ve fine-tuned your first principle and conceptual problem-solving skills. You can look at complex problems and solve them from start to finish.
Strong analytical skills: you nerd out about data, can quickly structure analyses to answer key business questions to drive decision-making, and will also have perspectives on building the right data architecture. Advanced Excel and Google Sheets skills, with experience building and managing complex data models and calculations.
Technical capabilities: Proven experience designing data warehouses and dashboards (e.g., Looker, Workday, BigQuery), working with SQL, and integrating data across People systems.
Flexibility and hustle: You manage change and ambiguity well, and have no problems juggling multiple priorities while executing in a fast-paced environment. You’re comfortable pivoting quickly and often.
5+ years of experience in people analytics, workforce strategy, or business analytics, ideally in a high-growth or tech environment.


US Employee Benefits

Verkada is committed to fostering a workplace environment that prioritizes the holistic health and wellbeing of our employees and their families by offering comprehensive wellness perks, benefits, and resources. Our benefits and perks programs include, but are not limited to:


Healthcare programs that can be tailored to meet the personal health and financial well-being needs -
Premiums are 100% covered for the employee under at least one plan and 80% for family premiums under all plans
Nationwide medical, vision and dental coverage
Health Saving Account (HSA) with annual employer contributions and Flexible Spending Account (FSA) with tax saving options
Expanded mental health support
Paid parental leave policy & fertility benefits
Time off to relax and recharge through our paid holidays, firmwide extended holidays, flexible PTO and personal sick time
Professional development stipend
Fertility Stipend Wellness/fitness benefits
Healthy lunches provided daily
Commuter benefits


Additional Information


You must be independently authorized to work in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment visa for this role, at this time.
This role requires on-site work from our headquarters in San Mateo, CA.


Annual Pay Range

At Verkada, we want to attract and retain the best employees, and compensate them in a way that appropriately and fairly values their individual contribution to the company. With that in mind, we carefully consider a number of factors to determine the appropriate starting pay for an employee, including their primary work location and an assessment of a candidate's skills and experience, as well as market demands and internal parity. A Verkada employee may be eligible for additional forms of compensation, depending on their role, including sales incentives, discretionary bonuses, and/or equity in the company in the form of restricted stock units (RSUs)

Below is the annual on-target earnings (OTE) range for full-time employees for this position, comprised of base compensation and commissions (if applicable).

Estimated Annual Pay Range

$140,000—$165,000 USD

Verkada Is An Equal Opportunity Employer

As an equal opportunity employer, Verkada is committed to providing employment opportunities to all individuals. All applicants for positions at Verkada will be treated without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex, gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.

Your application will be handled in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Policy.

$140,000—$165,000 USD

Verkada Is An Equal Opportunity Employer

As an equal opportunity employer, Verkada is committed to providing employment opportunities to all individuals. All applicants for positions at Verkada will be treated without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex, gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.

Your application will be handled in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Policy.

Title: Product Growth Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for growth leaders for products used by billions of people and businesses all over the world across our apps including Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and Oculus. This is a leadership opportunity to drive impact end-to-end through the product development life cycle. The product growth analyst role is embedded within product teams and requires using a mix of skills including analysis, product ideation, and cross-functional collaboration. Success in the role is tied directly to product goals and the team rewards results-based performance.The Growth practice was started right here at Meta, putting you at the forefront of the industry with great opportunity to learn about growth from experts. It is a lean and highly regarded team with an emphasis on regular sharing of successful strategies, tactics and insights across products. Our team values are to own the outcome, focus on driving sustainable impact, and put team success first. There is great opportunity to be a leader and influence the direction of high-visibility and high-impact initiatives, and to have your work come to life in some of the most widely used apps in the world.

Product Growth Analyst Responsibilities:


Lead growth strategy across a large product area and drive cross-team alignment
Drive long term growth of Meta Inc products through a combination of data analysis, product ideation, and experimentation to optimize product experiences
Understand trends in user behavior and product usage to influence growth strategy
Identify opportunities to drive growth and prioritize them to maximize long-term growth
Execute on projects by working closely with engineering and other members of product teams to land impact on product goals. Lead experimentation from designing tests to analyzing results that lead to launch decisions


Minimum Qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in a directly related field, or equivalent practical experience
6+ years of experience working in an analytical or product role
Proven to effectively collaborate across variety of technical and non-technical functions to drive towards common product goals
Experience working with and influencing multi disciplinary product teams consisting but not limited to software engineers, designers, product managers and data scientists
Proficiency in quantitative analysis geared towards drawing actionable insights from complex datasets
Experience performing exploratory analysis with minimal direction to answer ambiguous open ended questions
Experimentation experience to design multivariate tests, synthesize test results and build frameworks to make data-informed launch decisions
Product ideation skills to apply growth tactics broadly to different product areas and think through detailed elements of a product experience
Experience with data querying languages (for example, SQL)
Experience working on a product or service used by a wide-range of communities


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$133,000/year to $185,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.
